events.title: Resonanzraum Rolle
events.subtitle: Live performance and recording at the house of Günter Rolle.
events.shortDescription: Live performance and recording at the house of Günter Rolle. The house has its own tone and quiet history. We listen to how air, wood, and instruments react to each other.
body: The session takes place in the space where Günter Rolle once built and played his instruments. The house has its own tone and quiet history. Light, walls, and furniture hold the memory of earlier rehearsals.

We work with this memory as a resonant body. Microphones are placed close to objects and corners, contact mics follow surfaces, and small speakers move sound through the rooms. We listen to how air, wood, and instruments react to each other and let the space decide when the piece begins and ends.

events.title: Werkstatthaus Stuttgart
events.subtitle: Live session on resonance, movement, and listening.
events.shortDescription: Live session on resonance, movement, and listening. Inside Werkstatthaus, sound and movement are explored together. Each small change of position shifts what can be heard. The session invites quiet attention and shared presence.
body: The session takes place inside Werkstatthaus, a shared space for making, rehearsal, and experiments. Tables, tools, and walls are not hidden but become part of the staging. We treat the room as a moving instrument: sound travels between corners, between bodies, and between the different working areas of the house.

Movement and sound are developed together. Performers shift their position in relation to speakers, microphones, and the audience. Small changes in distance open or close parts of the room, revealing new resonances and cancelling others. The piece invites quiet attention: instead of following a fixed dramaturgy, we stay with the slow changes of the space itself.
